contents.text: Have you ever seen a unicorn?
contents.subtext2: Chapter 1: That magical thing behind the forest

contents.text: Do you want to know what's going to happen next?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text:
It is a warm summer day when Edith sits on the edge of the lake.

She is sketching a squirrel carrying an acorn. Edith has a big imagination.

Suddenly the squirrel runs away, leaping quickly into the dense forest nearby. 

Her drawing is half finished, so Edith chases the little critter into the forest.

As Edith runs, the forest gets denser and denser. There are more and more tall trees and bushy bushes. Edith is careful to step over roots and duck under branches. 

Eventually, Edith comes to a clearing in the forest. In the clearing, she sees the most magical thing she has ever seen.

It’s a unicorn!

The creature is almost like a horse, but shimmering white. The unicorn walks gracefully, unaware that he has been spotted.

Edith, who stands nearby, is frozen and in awe of her discovery.

Edith is out of breath and sweating a little from running. 

She wants to say "hi" to the wondrous creature, but she is at a loss for words. 

The next thing she does will change her life forever.
Edith is tired but still excited about the thing that she will discover. Can you talk about a time when being active with your family made you excited?
contents.subtext: Being 'active' means doing any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like dancing at home, swimming, or jumping jacks.

contents.text: What makes being active with your family exciting?
Physical activity can be an exciting way to bond as a family.

Chapter 2

Unicorn Run
Do you want to know what's going to happen with the Edith?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text:
Deep in the forest, there is a magnificent unicorn walking gracefully. Edith decides she wants to take a photo of this beautiful creature. She walks carefully, trying not to gasp or whisper a word. Her steps were muted by the thick grass on the forest floor.

Then something unexpected happens.

"Snap!"

Edith steps on a small dry twig and startles the unicorn! The unicorn, surprised and stunned, runs away immediately.
Edith chases the unicorn as fast as she can.
She is sweating and a little out of breath. Her heart is throbbing out of excitement.
This is the first time she has seen a unicorn so magnificent.
Discovering a unicorn is new for Edith. Tell a story when you tried a new physical activity. Did you face any challenges? How did you deal with those challenges?
contents.subtext: Physical activity is any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like dancing, playing on the playground, or playing sports such as baseball or soccer.

contents.text: You should congratulate yourself when you’re taking the steps to be active! It is a big deal!

Chapter 3:

The Shoes
Do you think Edith can chase the unicorn?
contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.

contents.text:
Edith runs further and deeper into the forest, chasing the unicorn that maneuvers at the speed of light.

It isn’t until about a thousand steps that Edith starts to outpace the unicorn.

"Hey Unicorn," says Edith. 

"Don't be scared, all I want is to take a picture with you."

The unicorn pauses and looks at Edith. 

 The unicorn looks upset.
Edith quickly hugs the unicorn and says: “No no don’t cry Uni, I am not going to hurt you. I just want to take a photo of you!”

"I am not scared of you. In fact, you look like a very friendly girl," says Uni the unicorn.

"But I lost my flying shoe. Without my flying shoe, I can't hover, fly, or glide."
“If I can’t hover, fly or glide, I will be late for my best friend’s birthday party,” says Uni.

"Oh I can help you with that!" says Edith.

"I'm good at finding lost things!"

"Let's retrace our steps to find your shoe so you can hover, fly, and glide. Then, you won't be late for your birthday party," says Edith

As they walk back retracing their steps, they see a glimmering object floating above a lake.

"That's my shoe," says Uni.

"Your shoe sure is shimmering," says Edith.

"But it's flying above the lake, how do I get it?" asks Uni.

"I can jump to those small rocks in the lake and grab your shoe," says Edith.

Edith jumps carefully on the rocks inside the lake, one by one until she is close enough to grab the floating unicorn shoe.

"I got your shoe!" yells Edith.

Uni the Unicorn claps with his hooves. 

Clap! Clap! Clap! 

He neighs in excitement.

contents.subtext: Being 'active' means doing any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like doing yoga, jumping rope, or skating.
contents.text: Edith helped the unicorn find his shoes. Can you tell a story about a time when someone helped you be more active?
How did this person’s help make it easier for you to be active?
Having support can make a big difference when trying to be healthy! Find someone who can support you in your health goals!
Chapter 4: When will we play again?

contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.
contents.text: Do you think the unicorn can get to the party on time?

"Thank you... what's your name?" asks Uni the Unicorn.

"My name is Edith," she says.

"Thank you, Edith. You are a real friend," says Uni.

"Now I have to go to my friend’s birthday party."

Uni starts to gallop then soars up high.

But Edith is upset because she doesn’t know when she will get to play with the unicorn again. As Uni fly higher and higher, Edith shouts "Can we play again sometime!?"

Uni stops going higher and floats mid-air.

"I will bring my friends tomorrow," says Uni.

The unicorn flies off and disappears in the distance.
The next day, Edith waits in the forest where she met the unicorn the day before. At exactly 12 o'clock, someone appears in the sky.

It's Uni the Unicorn again. He gallops down and lands on the meadow. 

Next to the unicorn, is a flying rhinoceros with a pair of big wings and a flying penguin with a pair of small wings.

"Edith, this is my friend Mike," says Uni, introducing the rhino. 

"And this is Linus," says the unicorn while pointing to the flying penguin. 

"This is my friend Edith who inspired me to be brave," says the Unicorn to Mike and Linus.
Edith couldn't be any happier to have not only one, but three new friends.

contents.subtext: Physical activity is any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like dancing, riding a bike, or hiking.
contents.text: Meeting new friends makes Edith happy. Tell a story when you were physically active with your friends. What did you like about it?
Being active with your friends can help you stay motivated.

The End

Your next story is:

"Cobby and the Game of Cowball"
